interface.name: Kompose
interface.summary: go from Docker Compose to Kubernetes
interface.description: Kompose is a tool to help users who are familiar with docker-compose move to Kubernetes. kompose takes a Docker Compose file and translates it into Kubernetes resources.

interface.name: Kubernetes Helm
interface.description: Helm is a tool for managing Kubernetes charts. Charts are packages of pre-configured Kubernetes resources.

interface.name: Kubernetes Operations (kops)
interface.summary: production grade Kubernetes installation, upgrades, and management
interface.description: kops helps you create, destroy, upgrade and maintain production-grade, highly available, Kubernetes clusters from the command line.

interface.name: Minikube
interface.description: Minikube is a tool that makes it easy to run Kubernetes locally. Minikube runs a single-node Kubernetes cluster inside a VM on your laptop for users looking to try out Kubernetes or develop with it day-to-day.

interface.name: Octant
interface.summary: web-based tool for visualizing Kubernetes clusters
interface.description: A web-based, highly extensible platform for developers to better understand the complexity of Kubernetes clusters.

interface.name: helmfile
interface.description: helmfile is a declarative spec for deploying Kubernetes Helm Charts.

interface.name: k9s
interface.summary: curses based terminal UI to interact with Kubernetes
interface.description: K9s provides a curses based terminal UI to interact with your Kubernetes clusters. The aim of this project is to make it easier to navigate, observe and manage your applications. This command line app continually watches Kubernetes for changes and offers subsequent commands to interact with observed resources.

interface.name: kubectl
interface.description: Command-line client that controls the Kubernetes cluster manager.

interface.name: svcat
interface.summary: CLI for interacting with Kubernetes Service Catalog
interface.description: This is a command-line interface (CLI) for interacting with Service Catalog resources. svcat is a domain-specific tool to make interacting with the Service Catalog easier. While many of its commands have analogs to kubectl, our goal is to streamline and optimize the operator experience.
